image.altText: Jim Chalmers reads the budget book in his office.

props.synopsis: A series of subheadings accidentally sent to the ABC by Treasury reveals extensive detail about its frank advice to the re-elected Albanese government.

title.children: Treasury advises Labor to consider higher taxes and a new housing target

image.altText: The front exterior of the Treasury building in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The persistence of Treasury officials in trying to get an innocuous document deleted served to highlight there was something there.

title.children: Fearless and free, the Treasury isn't holding back — and that's good for everyone

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony in China

props.synopsis: Just as Australia is asserting that its national interests are different from those of both China and the United States, it seems the US may force us into a choice we don't want to make.

title.children: China was the big disruptor in our region. Now the US is determined to take that title

image.altText: Jannik Sinner poses with the Wimbledon trophy

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner outclasses Carlos Alcaraz to claim the first Wimbledon title of his career, avenging his painful French Open final loss to the same opponent last month.

title.children: Sinner creates tennis history after outclassing Alcaraz in Wimbledon final

image.altText: Yasser Abu Shabab wears a combat vest and holds a rifle as he sits and poses for a picture.

props.synopsis: Violent gangs have been raiding convoys of aid as they are trucked through Gaza, and behind one of the largest groups is a criminal who has reportedly been armed and protected by Israel.

title.children: Gangs in Gaza raiding aid convoys believed to be backed by Israel

image.altText: Donald Trump frowns as he looks off camera while Xi Jinping stands behind him.

props.synopsis: It's entirely appropriate that Albanese is meeting Xi again before he meets Trump for the first time. Xi is more important than Trump now.

title.children: As Trump turns his back on renewables, China is building the future

image.altText: Trump is seen in profile close up with a bloodied face and hands on the ground

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump looks back on his near-assassination after he was shot at a rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, on July 13, 2024.

title.children: 'It was unforgettable': Donald Trump reflects on Butler assassination attempt, one year on

image.altText: A group of cricketers in white gather on the boundary.

props.synopsis: Australia's Josh Hazlewood strikes early to further expose a wounded West Indies top-order on day two of the day/night Test in Jamaica. Follow live.

title.children: Hazlewood strikes to expose wounded West Indies opener

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: OUT! Hazlewood gets King with his second ball
How things stand after day one

image.altText: flowers, work boots, a work hat on the floor outside westfield mount druitt in tribute to man shot by police

props.synopsis: NSW Police say a man, 29, fatally shot by police in the car park of a busy shopping centre in Western Sydney was carrying a large machete.

title.children: Man fatally shot by officer was husband of woman in 'melee', police say

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair and brown eyes smiles for the camera as she stands in front of plants

props.synopsis: WA Premier Roger Cook says rescued German backpacker Carolina Wilga is in high spirits despite her outback ordeal, which saw her spend 11 nights in freezing temperatures.

title.children: WA premier issues warning over outback travel after backpacker's ordeal

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Older generations will transfer trillions of dollars in wealth to younger generations in coming decades, but how will it be managed?

title.children: Another economist warns about intergenerational wealth in Australia

image.altText: Dozens of young Palestinian men run on a road

props.synopsis: At least 31 Palestinians were fatally shot on their way to an aid distribution site in the Gaza Strip while Israeli air strikes killed at least another 28 the same day.

title.children: Dozens of Palestinians reportedly killed while seeking aid

image.altText: A doctor with a glove on pricks the finger of a small African child with a small amount of blood showing on the fingertip.

props.synopsis: The UN says the withdrawal of US funding for the global HIV fight could lead to more than 4 million AIDS-related deaths and over 6 million additional HIV infections by 2029 if not replaced.

title.children: It took Trump six months to 'dismantle' decades of HIV progress, experts say

image.altText: Metal and timber hut with verandah, plastic chair, tables, man in ranger clothing to left, surf board on sand ground, trees

props.synopsis: A group of 18 people have been fined thousands of dollars after an unauthorised cabin was found on a central Queensland island.

title.children: Illegal holiday cabin built in national park on Queensland island

image.altText: three stern looking men with black suits and ties sit at table with three flags behind them.

props.synopsis: France has announced an agreement aimed at granting more autonomy to New Caledonia in the south Pacific, but stopped short of the independence sought by many Indigenous Kanaks.

title.children: France agrees to New Caledonian state, but not independence

image.altText: Man stands at lectern with large crowd watching on

props.synopsis: With less than a week of the Tasmanian election campaign to go, state Labor has announced an expansion of its pledge to operate free GP clinics. But the challenge of staffing them remains.

title.children: More free GP clinics pledged as Tasmanian Labor officially launches campaign

image.altText: Two men sitting alongside two women dressed in shawls in a green-painted sitting room

props.synopsis: The grieving families of people killed when Air India Flight 171 crashed in Ahmedabad are demanding that a final report into the incident provides clarity about what caused the tragedy.

title.children: Air India crash families were hoping for answers but are now asking more questions

image.altText: A Sydney Swans player raises his hands in triumph as St Kilda players look dejected in the background after a game.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans trail most of the day against St Kilda before grabbing a season-saving win at Docklands, as Port Adelaide overcomes the Eagles in Adelaide.

title.children: Swans snatch points to keep finals hopes alive, Power survive Eagles scare

image.altText: Reece Walsh of the Broncos does a cartwheel

props.synopsis: The Brisbane Broncos and Penrith Panthers have recorded five straight NRL wins, with derby victories over rivals on Sunday.

title.children: Cartwheeling Walsh guides Broncos to fifth-straight NRL win

image.altText: Cockleshells on Goolwa Beach.

props.synopsis: A royal commission is needed to tackle the long-term consequences of the devastating algal bloom that is killing marine life and damaging industries along the SA coast, the state's opposition says.

title.children: Algal bloom 'disaster' prompts royal commission call as impact spreads

image.altText: Joshua Brown in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government is facing calls for a full review into authorities' handling of complaints about accused childcare abuser Joshua Brown's conduct in the two years before his arrest.

title.children: Calls for review into 'outrageous' handling of childcare complaints

image.altText: a woman with short hair holding a baby of Asian descent above her head, both smiling.

props.synopsis: Ute Young was only expecting one baby from Vietnam when she raced from rural South Australia to Melbourne Airport on Christmas Eve 1973. Instead, she was handed three.

title.children: A late-night phone call, a frantic flight and a baby in need of a mum

image.altText: Boxes of cigarettes surrounded by Australian cash.

props.synopsis: ATM suppliers compete for illegal tobacco man's business, with transactions dwarfing typical Australian machines

title.children: Private tobacco shop ATMs generate triple normal transactions

image.altText: Pat Conroy press club

props.synopsis: The acting defence minister says he was advised the Trump administration's review was incomplete, as he defends Australia's approach to defence spending.

title.children: US review of AUKUS incomplete as cost of defence boost revealed

image.altText: A woman in a red jumper and cap smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Recent rain in southern New South Wales has put water in dams and given paddocks a healthier tinge, but farmers say the drought is far from over and they need financial assistance.

title.children: Farmers call for financial assistance as 'green drought' takes a toll

image.altText: NH-90 New Zealand Helicopter bushfires

props.synopsis: A version of the Taipan helicopter that Australia’s Army permanently grounded after a deadly crash two years ago will be involved in the international military exercises where the devastating accident occurred.

title.children: Taipan-like helicopter to fly again during Talisman Sabre exercises

image.altText: Black and white images of a costume fitting.

props.synopsis: The name of Australian-born costume designer Orry-Kelly, a three-time Academy Award winner, may not be familiar. But the NSW town of Kiama hopes to change that with a gala event featuring gowns and plenty of glamour.

title.children: Despite a glittering Hollywood career, you may not have heard of Orry-Kelly

image.altText: a wall covered in aboriginal street art

props.synopsis: The NT coroner this week handed down her findings into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, almost six years after he was fatally shot in Yuendumu.

title.children: Six years after Kumanjayi Walker's shooting, a reckoning within NT police is inescapable

image.altText: Housing longread header

props.synopsis: The Yes In My Backyard movement is lobbying for denser cities and more housing in places people want to work and live and YIMBYs want these homes built yesterday. But the NIMBYs haven't given up yet.

title.children: YIMBYs vs NIMBYs in the battle for your backyard

image.altText: Daniel Principe, dressed in black shirt and pants, standing in the school basketball court at night.

props.synopsis: Teenage boys are being bombarded with toxic content online about masculinity and the opposite sex. Now, misogyny is rising in Australian schools, and it's pushing teachers to the brink.

title.children: How the 'manosphere' is fuelling teen misogyny inside Australian schools

image.altText: Smoke pours from the top of the Grand canyon

props.synopsis: Two fast-spreading wildfires force the evacuation of parts of the Grand Canyon, with the US National Park Service ordering visitors and residents away from its northern rim.

title.children: Multiple wildfires force evacuations at Grand Canyon

image.altText: a black and white drawing of a man in sunglasses next to a colour drawing of a mans head

props.synopsis: Newly released FBI files reveal fresh details about the hunt for a man who hijacked a plane and parachuted to freedom with more than $300,000 in ransom money.

title.children: New FBI files reveal suspects, tips and hoaxes in DB Cooper cold case

image.altText: An Asian woman sitting on a couch looking bored

props.synopsis: Experts say there are benefits to being bored and ways we can build it into our day.

title.children: The benefits of boredom: How moments of pause can improve our wellbeing

image.altText: Woman standing with powerful stance in shallow water with lake and hills behind her

props.synopsis: Big hART's Punkaliyarra project connects women from opposite sides of the continent, "reigniting old pathways" and keeping culture alive.

title.children: Unlocking the 'hidden and radical' power of First Nations women
